column4: actually if you check the forums, I just backported zSNES 1.4.2 for Hoary
I just now scrolled up and read
zSNES is in x86 assembly, so doesn't work with 64-bit :(
no, not unless someone ports it to x64, which won't happen. try snes9x :/
sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list and make sure the lines with deb-src are uncommented, especially the one with multiverse
yeah I have the multiverse with sources
the only thing I can think then is that apt has decided that you can't build snes9x on an x64 system, maybe for the same reason as zSNES
ok.. so basically SNES emulation isn't possible on a 64-bit machine running Ubuntu now.. that's great
I think you're gonna have to somehow get a 32-bit environment set up inside your 64-bit. or do what zyth suggested and try it through wine?
